Functions

01200_TEE_ResetPropertyEnumerator
[GP_010_Properties]

Functions

 TestCase_GC068_Start12Enumerators ()
 TestCase_BC069_enumeratorNull ()

Detailed Description

Description:
: Resets a property enumerator.

void TEE_ResetPropertyEnumerator( TEE_PropSetHandle enumerator );

For this test, we will need at least one TA.

Pre: Open a session to a GPTA.

Post: Close session and check that it succeeds.

Function Documentation

TestCase_GC068_Start12Enumerators (  )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
05040000000000000000000000000001 6b28a6d436fe5fb9b5ed59cba151a0fc
Pre Conditions:
05040000000000000000000000000001.[drbin/tlbin] is loaded.
Focus:
Test the functionality of TEE_ResetPropertyEnumerator().
Test Steps:
In a loop, 12 iterations:
  • Call TEE_AllocatePropertyEnumerator(), verify that the result is TEE_SUCCESS, alternating on 3 property sets: -- TEE_PROPSET_CURRENT_TA -- TEE_PROPSET_CURRENT_CLIENT -- TEE_PROPSET_TEE_IMPLEMENTATION
  • Call TEE_GetPropertyName() to get the name of the first property and store it for each enumerator
  • Call TEE_GetNextProperty() a random number of times from 1-5 on each enumerator
  • if TEE_GetNextProperty() returns TEE_SUCCESS, call TEE_GetPropertyName() to get the current property name and verify that it does not match the initial name In a loop, 12 iterations:
  • Call TEE_ResetPropertyEnumerator()
  • Call TEE_GetPropertyName() and make sure it matches the initial name for the enumerator Call TEE_FreePropertyEnumerator() in a loop to free all previously-allocated enumerators
Post Conditions:
none
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
No
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
No
Quick Testcase:
No
Minimum Product Version required for this testcase:
400A
Test ID:
GP_010_Properties.01200_TEE_ResetPropertyEnumerator.GC068_Start12Enumerators

Attempt to reset a NULL enumerator.
Test Steps:
Call TEE_ResetPropertyEnumerator() with NULL enumerator, which should cause a TA panic
